Title: hp comes to terms with the cloud
Abstract: hewlett-packard has decided it cannot compete with the likes of amazon and google for one of the hottest new businesses. instead, on the eve of its split into two companies, hp is learning about collaborative technologies, and not just for its customers.

Title: liquid-cooled supercomputers, to trim the power bill
Abstract: looking to reduce energy bills and environmental strains, operators of supercomputers are immersing them in cooling liquids.

Title: google joins a heavyweight competition in cloud computing
Abstract: the search giant, which for years has been evasive about its plans for the cloud, is announcing rates and features for a wide-ranging computing service.

Title: headphones for protection, not cranking it up
Abstract: the 3m tekk protection worktunes headphones keep excessive noise out, and won't damage your ears with loud music levels, either.

Title: addressing fears about led light bulbs
Abstract: a column about led light bulbs generated a lot of reader e-mail, probably because led represents change. and change is always scary. david pogue addresses some reader concerns.

Title: new reasons to change light bulbs
Abstract: led bulbs last longer and use less power than older ones, and with prices falling, a change makes even more sense.

Title: blurry backgrounds, big sensors and bokeh
Abstract: david pogue analyzes the debate on blurry photo backgrounds and how cameras get them.

Title: stanford r. ovshinsky dies at 89, a self-taught maverick in electronics
Abstract: a self-taught scientist, mr. ovshinsky invented the nickel-metal hybrid battery and contributed to the development of many other devices.

Title: ex-apple leaders push the humble thermostat into the digital age
Abstract: nest labs, a silicon valley start-up, is trying to transform the household thermostat into a digital assistant that reduces energy consumption.

Title: the ipad in your hand: as fast as a supercomputer of yore
Abstract: a computer scientist who tracks the mathematical capabilities of computers has found that the ipad 2 is as fast as a supercomputer from years ago.

Title: how to clean a lens the right way
Abstract: even something as simple as wiping a lens can be done the wrong way, with disastrous results. here's the right way.

Title: headphones that produce quiet and side effects
Abstract: headphones that use active noise reduction can leave some users feeling queasy. also, sticky notes on windows 7 and counting characters on iphone text messages.

Title: looking for better sound? here's a tip
Abstract: earbuds shape up with these after-market tips.

Title: did a speeding car just jump out of my cellphone?
Abstract: the small screens of cellphones can lend themselves well to glasses-free three-dimensional effects, experts say.

Abstract: amazon, microsoft, google and others are now trying to rent large corporations the remote use of their technology infrastructure, but some concerns remain after a few cautious steps into cloud services.

Abstract: at&t said the charge reflected changes to how medicare subsidies were taxed because of the new health care law.

Abstract: pc maker hewlett-packard is expected to add a mini projector to a laptop later this year.

Abstract: a film from 3m that obscures your phone's screen from casual busybodies is now available in custom sizes for most phones.

Abstract: one of the many exciting demos shown at this year's ted conference.

Abstract: the telecom giant and media behemoth defended their proposed $85.4 billion merger in a senate hearing.

Abstract: the plan is intended to free consumers from renting the boxes, which cost them $231 a year on average.

Abstract: restaurants in palo alto are increasingly struggling as rents soar and workers are hired away by the corporate cafeterias of behemoths like google.

Abstract: video games have become more inclusive regarding gender and sexuality, adding features to accommodate l.g.b.t. players.

Abstract: the digital beasts have been reported at auschwitz and memorials for the holocaust and the sept. 11 attacks.

Abstract: the app has long taken a back seat to the social media giant's whatsapp, but facebook hopes the service will attract a global audience.

Abstract: the company, despite an aggressive lobbying effort, has not been able to persuade some local legislators to work with it.

Abstract: previously, companies had to apply for special permission to operate drones. now a range of businesses may use drones under 55 pounds, but not for package delivery.

Abstract: a dusty old computer in a mom-and-pop wisconsin welding shop is giving a digital security firm a window into the operations of chinese hackers.

Abstract: facebook has become a critical tool for visibility and acceptance, and is seen as contributing to the shift in mainstream attitudes toward transgender people.

Abstract: snapchat is enjoying a positive run, and the leading presidential candidates have both expressed skepticism toward the tech industry.

Title: regeneron pharmaceuticals to sponsor science talent search
Abstract: the biotechnology company will sharply increase funding for the longtime high school contest with which intel ended its relationship last year.

Abstract: a study of 10 million facebook posts found that american men more likely to swear, express anger and argue; women used kinder yet more assertive language.

Abstract: the social media platform has served mr. trump's bombast and provocations well, but such behavior may be poison to a general election campaign.

Abstract: its algorithms are as infused with bias as any human decision, but neither it nor its audience thinks of facebook as a news organization with editorial responsibilities.

Abstract: facebook responded to a report by the website gizmodo that accused the social network of suppressing stories from conservative news sources.

Title: police and tech giants wrangle over encryption on capitol hill
Abstract: behind-the-scenes lobbying heightens in this next phase of a divide over digital security that erupted when apple refused to help unlock an iphone used in a mass shooting.

Abstract: government officials and apple representatives showed no sign of compromise in their battle over encryption and privacy, as they appeared before a congressional panel.

Title: amazon may violate india's new rules on foreign e-commerce
Abstract: the government added regulations related to pricing and the sourcing of sales on sites that amazon and several rivals appear to break.

Abstract: the city is bulging, the rents soaring, and residents are growing more vocal about wishing silicon valley would cool off, or at least pay up.

Abstract: the justice department said a federal judge had erred in not ordering apple to unlock a drug dealer's iphone, in a case being watched by lawyers and experts on both sides of the encryption debate.

Title: a plan in case robots take the jobs: give everyone a paycheck
Abstract: for some technologists, machine intelligence is not seen as a job-killing catastrophe, but something like a windfall that could lead to universal basic income.

Abstract: the company, in its fight with the f.b.i., is defending its phones on grounds that its code represents free speech, and there is some precedent.

Title: public split between concern over terrorism and privacy
Abstract: a survey found that 54 percent of the public said they were very or somewhat concerned about the loss of privacy, while 44 percent were not very concerned or not at all concerned.

Title: fighting fraud on multiple fronts
Abstract: fake text messages about your financial accounts are just some of the many schemes going around.

Abstract: chips with military as well as electronics uses came under focus when washington officials killed a $2.9 billion chinese investment.

Abstract: privacy watchdogs from european union countries expressed doubts that a new data-transfer pact with the united states could protect personal information.

Abstract: the agreement would let businesses like google and facebook continue to move personal data across the atlantic, but european privacy officials may balk.

Abstract: officials were far apart on sunday over a trans-atlantic pact that international companies must rely on to move digital data between the regions.

Title: facebook moves to ban private gun sales on its site and instagram
Abstract: the ban, which does not apply to posts by licensed gun dealers, will also apply to the company's photo-sharing service.

Abstract: leslie berland, a former american express executive, was named twitter's chief marketing officer, taking over a position that has been in flux in recent years.

Abstract: the start-up's founder and chief says happiness, in particular the happiness of his employees, will separate his company from ventures that have failed.

Abstract: the deal, in a huge digital market, may give a boost to apple pay, which lets users pay for goods by holding a mobile device near a credit card reader.

Abstract: mr. zuckerberg's new openness on social media has met up with business considerations.

Title: researchers track tricky payment theft scheme
Abstract: about two years after a hack at target became national news, retailers are determined to avoid a similar disaster.

Abstract: a new batch of symbols is under review by the unicode consortium, a group that regulates standards for every bit of text displayed online.

Abstract: a blog post by crowdstrike said that the attacks had continued despite an agreement to end them between washington and beijing.

Abstract: the official, hao yeli, said removing developing countries' ability to control public opinion through internet controls and surveillance would not result in more openness.

Abstract: the partnership will allow lyft, which is based in san francisco, to operate in china for the first time.

Abstract: the high school competition counts among its past competitors eight nobel prize winners, along with chief executives, university professors and award-winning scientists.

Title: izettle, a swedish payments start-up, begins a lending program
Abstract: the company also announced that it had raised an additional $67 million from its backers.

Title: jeff bezos and amazon employees join debate over its culture
Abstract: the company's chief told employees that he didn't recognize the "soulless, dystopian workplace" that he said was depicted in a new york times article.

Title: after nokia layoffs, tech workers in finland regroup and refocus
Abstract: thousands of laid-off workers have started their own businesses or have been recruited by other tech companies lured to finland by its surplus of talent.

Title: for mobile messaging, gifs prove to be worth at least a thousand words
Abstract: animated, looping images are experiencing a surge on mobile devices, growing an industry and providing textless messages for millions of users.

Title: german carmakers buy nokia's here mapping unit for $3 billion
Abstract: a consortium including audi, bmw group and daimler will acquire here as technology and digital maps become an increasingly important part of the car industry's future.

Title: stripe, digital payments start-up, raises new funding and partners with visa
Abstract: the san francisco-based digital payments start-up now has a $5 billion valuation and a partnership with visa to help it compete.

Title: ashley madison, a dating website, says hackers may have data on millions
Abstract: those who breached the site, which is marketed to those seeking extramarital affairs, threatened to release information about users.

Title: ebay reports sale of enterprise unit as earnings beat estimates
Abstract: the company said it had sold the unit for $925 million and its operating earnings had risen 9 percent, well above the average estimate of analysts.

Title: scent received, with a tap of a smartphone
Abstract: developers are getting ready to introduce products that would allow smartphone users to send and receive scents along with messages and photos.

Title: as more tech start-ups stay private, so does the money
Abstract: fledgling companies are increasingly delaying initial public offerings of stock, which can keep the risks -- and rewards -- limited to venture capitalists and hedge funds.

Title: court denies requests to keep new net neutrality rules from taking effect on friday
Abstract: the united states court of appeals for the district of columbia circuit denied numerous petitions to keep new internet regulations from going into effect.

Title: republicans resist f.c.c. proposal for lifeline broadband subsidies
Abstract: lawmakers at a senate hearing did not dispute the benefits of broadband, but said the current lifeline program for poor americans had been mismanaged.

Abstract: americans have long expressed dissatisfaction with their cable and internet service. this year, they seem to have grown even more dissatisfied.

Title: a primer on android pay and google wallet
Abstract: here is how google's new mobile payments products -- android pay and google wallet -- are set to work.

Title: f.c.c. chief seeks broadband plan to aid the poor
Abstract: the plan will suggest sweeping changes to a $1.7 billion subsidy program charged with ensuring all americans have affordable access to advanced telecommunications services.

Title: as facebook sweeps across europe, regulators gird for battle
Abstract: the european court of justice is expected to issue a preliminary decision over whether the social network giant can continue transferring data between europe and the united states.

Title: paypal unit helps lift ebay revenue
Abstract: the first-quarter results, with revenue topping analyst forecasts, are a progress marker for ebay as it divides into two parts this year: its troubled marketplace business and its payments unit.

Title: jackpots for local tv stations in f.c.c. auction of airwaves
Abstract: the federal communications commission is trying to persuade hundreds of tv stations to part with some of the most desirable airwaves, which would be acquired by mobile providers.

Abstract: the social media giant has ambitious plans for its messaging service, including linking business to its user base.

Title: daily report: apple pay and banks tussle over fraud
Abstract: one obstacle has been the banks' own reluctance to press apple for fear of upsetting their relationships with the tech giant.

Title: a police gadget tracks phones? shhh! it's secret
Abstract: a growing number of law enforcement agencies have acquired sophisticated surveillance technology to track cellphones but have done so with an unusual restriction: they must not talk about it.

Abstract: large mobile carriers and tech giants like facebook and google rely on one another, but they are competing to be consumers' main source for internet use on mobile devices.

Title: samsung galaxy s6 and galaxy s6 edge, unveiled at mobile world congress, offer best of iphone and more
Abstract: samsung has been accused of being a copycat, but after adding its own design twists to popular features borrowed from the competition, its new flagship phone feels like a real flagship.

Abstract: the company said it would delay a quarterly earnings report as a result of disruptions to the computer network at its american film studio, sony pictures entertainment.

Abstract: these services let you use your own mobile devices to either stream free content like tv, music or games, or to rent movies and tv without having to pay for a wi-fi plan.

Abstract: despite growing fears of its invincibility, amazon could be threatened as smartphones transform the way americans shop and goods are delivered.

Abstract: the new european commission is prioritizing more investment and costlier internet and cellphone services rather than affordability and antitrust concerns.

Abstract: mobile apps offer news and opinion on politicians and issues, and even information straight from congress and the white house.

Abstract: the company announced a wearable device, two new versions of its smartphones and an integrated payments system.

Title: t-mobile offers iphone tests and unlimited music streaming
